Stem: 14 The following table lists functions of some structures within the human body. Fill in the table below by identifying the correct human body structure with its function. Each choice must only be used once. Human Body Structure Function a Carries oxygen throughout the body. b Contracts to expand the abdomen. c Stores and controls the release of urine from the body. d Surrounds structures in the head, such as the brain. a b c Bladder Bladder Bladder Cranium Cranium Cranium Diaphragm Diaphragm Diaphragm Red blood cell Red blood cell Red blood cell d Bladder Cranium Diaphragm Red blood cell Sinkholes are depressions that form at Earth’s surface. Sometimes they result from the lowering of groundwater levels in aquifers. Groundwater provides extra support to help stabilize these rocks. When water levels in an aquifer decrease, the rocks originally holding the water can become weak, and sinkholes can result. The San Joaquin Valley in California, known for its fruit and nut orchards and large vegetable farms, uses water from local aquifers for irrigation. The highest demand for groundwater in this region is generally during the spring and summer, which are not only peak growing seasons but also the driest seasons of the year. In May 2016, a large sinkhole opened up in a lane of Interstate 5 in the San Joaquin Valley. During the time of the sinkhole occurrence, the San Joaquin Valley was experiencing extreme levels of drought. Is there a possible relationship between the sinkhole on Interstate 5 and human activity? Why or why not?
Choices: A) Yes; removing vegetation to build the interstate contaminated the aquifer., B) Yes; irrigation during a time of significant drought put stress on the aquifer., C) No; precipitation would refill the aquifer as fast as the farms use it for irrigation., D) No; sinkholes are a natural occurrence, so human activity does not affect them.
